title: ziggs passive
body: Does some know if ziggs passive apply deathfire touch ? or if count as 2 hit for thunderlord ?  thk

replies.body: It doesn't apply DFT or count as two hits for TLord's.
It doesnt give 2 stacks of Thunderlords? :o  I really expected it to lol.

On-hit effects are counted as part of the AA and not separate.

Otherwise. in theory. if you had two on-hit effects and auto-attacked, you would proc Thunderlord's immediately.
{{champion:121}}  passive counts as two hits though

it doesn't count as a second AA, it just uses on-spell effeckts, wich incloudes thunderlords, dft, rylias or muramana, though theoretically they changed muramana a long time ago to not double proc on AA-modifiers that use on-spell, it was pretty absurd on jax as befor that, W and Ult would double proc it.
However, don't ask me why Kahs passive or jax'sstuff does use on-splee, but ziggs passive doesn't, that's beyond me and i honestly think riot simply does not a have a clear line on what such stoff counts as proc(which uses no on-spell or similar things) and which actually is counted as spell damage...
Didnt know about the second Muramana proc, wow
Well Lux passive gives 2 so I thought Ziggs passive did as well :s
Her passive isn't an "on-hit effect" because it triggers the damage, not as part of the AA, but as part of the passive's debuff being removed by the AA.
ekko's E counts as 2 hits towards tld and its only an on hit effect.  so do most things. don't make stuff up please

Ekko's is E a bit different due to it being treated as a spell+AA (Empowered AA) versus Ziggs' Passive which is only consider an AA + an on-hit effect.

Please do check for yourself. 

Or just think of Teemo's E, Riot treats Ziggs' Passive the same way.
